channel.title: The Zen Programming Language
channel.description: Recent content on The Zen Programming Language

item.description: Chapter 1 Introduction to Zen This chapter is a gentle introduction to the world of Zen.

item.title: Basics of Zen
item.description: Chapter 3 Basics of Zen In this chapter, you will learn the basics of writing simple Zen programs.

item.title: Variables, Values, and Data Types
item.description: Chapter 4 Variables, Values, and Data Types In this chapter, you will learn the basics of working with variables in Java.

item.title: Operators, Operands, and Expressions
item.description: Chapter 4 +++ title = “Understanding Operators” +++ In this lecture, you will learn about operators.

item.title: Conditional Statements
item.description: Chapter 6 Conditional Statements: How Your Programs Make Choices So far in this book, all the programs have run in a linear fashion.

item.title: Loop Statements
item.description: Chapter 7 Loop Statements: How Your Programs Repeat Things One thing computers enjoy doing more than anything else is repeating themselves.

item.title: Introduction to Object Oriented Programming
item.description: Chapter 8 Introduction to Object Oriented Programming Zen is a pure object-oriented programming language.

item.title: Classes and Objects
item.description: Chapter 9 Classes and Objects You have been using classes since the beginning of this manual.

item.title: Functions
item.description: Chapter 10 Functions In Zen all programs are built with classes, which means there is at least one class.

item.title: Constructors
item.description: Chapter 11 Constructors: How Your Objects are Initialized When you create an object using the new operator, Zen does several things for you.

item.title: Superclasses and Subclasses
item.description: Chapter 11 Superclasses and Subclasses Inheritance is a very important feature of object-oriented programming, a mechanism which allows one class to inherit the behaviors and attributes from another class.

item.title: Exceptions
item.description: Chapter 14 Exceptions No matter how carefully you design and test your program, errors are bound to happen one or the other.

item.title: Packages
item.description: Chapter 15 Packages: How Your Source Code is Organized Imagine you have two classes, one of which represents a component that reads data from the console.

item.title: Arrays
item.description: Chapter 16 Arrays So far in this manual, you have written programs which work with few variables.

item.title: Strings
item.description: Chapter 16 Strings A string is a very common object in Zen.
